- I'm sorry, Robbie. 
- Oh, well. Oh, dear.

1515.84.text:
- So I'm afraid I can only give you one point. 
- One point!

1521.48.text: Let's get back to the desk to add up the scores.

1526.48.text: And so we return from our wanderings in space

1529.20.text: and time to gaze in wonder at the scores.

1533.96.text: Kate and Hallie, you got one point there.

1536.60.text: I'm sorry to have to tell you,

1537.88.text: though, that Lars and Nina managed to garner three points.

1542.28.text: Which means that they are standing at 13 and you are standing at four.

1546.68.text: But 13, what a magnificent score, and you might be able to add to that

1551.24.text: as we go on into our final quickfire round.

1555.76.text: Here's a uniform worn by the members

1564.24.text: Good. Fingers on the buzzers again

1565.92.text: because this is a magic lantern slide,

1567.72.text: but what children's classic does it portray?

1571.28.text:
- Peter Pan. 
- Peter Pan there, yes.

1574.04.text: This dolls' house was made in 1673.

1577.88.text: What does the unicorn...? BEEP AND BUZZER

1580.44.text: It tells us that it was the house of an apothecary or chemist

1584.72.text: That was the profession of the occupants. They were apothecaries.

1588.40.text: Look at this. What are the pouches for on this girls' nightcap?

1594.04.text:
- Not catching fleas. 
- Curls. 
- They were for setting her curls.

1597.88.text: This is an Italian presepio scene.

1599.96.text: What city is the centre of their manufacture? BUZZER

1605.16.text: This is Action Man. By what name is he known in...? BUZZER

1610.88.text: The first Rubik's cubes hit the toy shops in 1977.

1614.96.text: What is their Hungarian inventor's first name?

1622.04.text:
- Erno? 
- Ernest? 
- Erno, yes. You're quite right. You got that, good.

1626.56.text:
- What?! 
- Don't get in a state. You're well ahead.

1631.32.text: Let the girls have just one crumb from your table.

1636.68.text: What feature of this teething stick

1639.84.text: was supposed to prevent the spread of evil? BEEP AND BUZZER

1644.44.text: This is He-Man, a master of the universe.

1646.40.text: What was the name of his nemesis? BUZZER

1650.40.text: This is an 18th-century pudding hat for toddlers.

1652.60.text: What was it used for? BEEP AND BUZZER

1654.24.text: When they were walking, it meant when they fell,

1656.32.text:
- they wouldn't hurt their heads. 
- Yes. 
- Like a helmet.

1658.56.text: To protect them when learning to walk.

1660.20.text: Who joined Santa's sleigh team in 1939? BEEP

1666.16.text: Rudolph the Red-nosed Reindeer. SLEIGH BELLS

1669.08.text: And the sound of Santa's sleigh bells tells me

1671.72.text: that playtime has to come to an end.

1674.32.text: But before we hang up our stockings and go to bed,

1676.92.text: let's have a look at our final scores.

1679.28.text: Kate and Hallie, you did very, very well in that round

1682.56.text: because you got some points and made up your total to nine.

1687.12.text: But I'm afraid it is only half

1690.24.text: of Lars and Nina's triumphant score of 18.

1698.20.text: You've won the last of our series because we've come

1701.00.text: to the end of our time here in this, the world's ultimate toy box.

1708.40.text: being grown-up is a terribly hard thing to do.

1710.56.text: It's much easier to skip it and go from one childhood to another.

1713.84.text: And so we must thank the museum here today for preserving

1716.40.text: so many childhood memories for us.

1718.44.text: Thank you, goodbye and merry Christmas.
